history.content: You need to take a total of 20 CS/EE/EECS upper div units, PLUS an additional 7 units of CS/EE/EECS or tech electives. In general that means a total of 7 classes, at least 5 of which are CS/EE/EECS.

Website (https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv) says upper division CS requirements include 20 upper division units, 8 of which are upper division CS/EE/EECS courses. Under the next main bullet, it requires 7 upper division technical electives--but it notes that these 7 units can be either upper division CS/EE/EECS courses or an approved technical elective.

Does this mean that:

-I can take 8 units CS/EE/EECS courses (within the required 20 upper div units portion) and simultaneously fulfill the 7 upper division technical electives requirement? OR

-I have to take 8 units CS/EE/EECS plus an additional 7 units of either CS/EE/EECS or techinca electives?
history.subject: CS upper div req double counting?
